TopicTitle: MAVEN Replica (HyperEdit recommended and needs AIES Aerospace and B9 Aerospace)

Articles.Content:
This is the replica of NASA'S MAVEN spacecraft. I copied it by Bob Fitch on a timelapse but there was no download. Click here to download.

Edited August 13, 2014 by CDK
Can somebody reply to let me know that somebody has downloaded it?

Can somebody reply to let me know that somebody has downloaded it?

I don't think you have gotten a download because you are clearly using mods but don't have a list of required mods, so people don't know what they need to use it.
Just AIES Aerospace and HyperEdit is recommended.
The mod list is on the title, AIES Aerospace and HyperEdit is recommended.
Pretty cool. But why is Hyperedit recommended?

if you want to build a rocket under it you can, but when launched from a rocket (any rocket that I could build (in the first place I wanted to build a replica)) it started falling out of the fairings.
I want somebody to reply, but please don't think I'm annoying by saying I want somebody to reply in almost every reply.

Well first of all, you're using B9 for the struts at the bottom. Also, it doesnt look a great deal like MAVEN, you could make it look a whole lot better, it almost seems like you rushed it. All in all though, its not bad.
I wish I could edit the title!

I wish I could edit the title!

you can. Choose advanced mode when you edit the post.

And thank you for sharing!

Thank you!

Edited August 13, 2014 by CDK
Spelling Fix

That looks really nice! Also, MAVEN should be arriving at Mars soon, I don't remember the date but I think it's in September.

Edit: yep, September 22, 2014

Thanks! And I haven't checked any of NASA's schedules yet so thanks for the information or else I wouldn't know anything that's going to happen and I think I'm going to check the schedules on NASA's website.

Once again thanks!
Bob Fitch used Infernal Robotics so the solar panels could move. I'm probably going to make an updated one with Infernal Robotics.
